Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

Where You Come In
Join a team of Data Scientists and Data Science Analysts that develop analytical frameworks and reliable measurement strategies for Yelp products
Design, execute, and analyze complex business and user experiments
Partner with other Data Scientists and Data Engineers to set the vision for and develop our experimentation platform
Devise and evaluate models for diverse business needs, such as identifying growth opportunities, estimating the impact of new features on our platforms, and personalizing the user experience
Proactively research and build ETL pipelines for product and marketplace metrics
Communicate key insights from analyses, experiments and data products to stakeholders

What It Takes To Succeed
MS/PhD in quantitative field and 3+ years of industry experience in a senior quantitative role
Ability to apply statistical, analytical and technical expertise to product and business problems
Prior experience structuring and leading impactful data science projects independently
Oral and written communication skills to mentor colleagues, and work effectively with partners on engineering, product and business teams
Expertise in SQL, and R or Python for data analysis and platform development
Enthusiasm for building a culture of learning and development

It's Nice To Have
Product analytics experience with small business or consumer technology products
Prior industry experience building online experimentation and machine learning platforms

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.

We will consider for employment qualified candidates with arrest and conviction records, consistent with applicable law (including, for example, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance for roles based in San Francisco).

CCPA Privacy Notice

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)


Primary Location

Skillman, NJ flexible to other NJ sites

Philadelphia, PA

Minneapolis, MN

Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Working with Johnson & Johnson can change everything. Including YOU.

Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models

Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)


Primary Location

Skillman, NJ flexible to other NJ sites

Philadelphia, PA

Minneapolis, MN

Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

2105973674W

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood

Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)


Primary Location

Skillman, NJ flexible to other NJ sites

Philadelphia, PA

Minneapolis, MN

2105973674W

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets

Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)

Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)

You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)

Skillman, NJ flexible to other NJ sites

Philadelphia, PA

Minneapolis, MN

2105973674W

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)

#JNJDataScience

Primary Location

United States-New Jersey-Skillman-199 Grandview Road

Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. (6077)

Job Function

R&D

Requisition ID

2105973674W

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.

Work you'll do

Develop, test, and deploy new data science models according to agency needs. This requires skills in predictive modeling, forecasting, machine learning, deep learning, multi-classification, risk analysis, and data pre-processing.

The team

Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.

The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to deliver insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.
